fields.description:
It appears that files pulled from a resource don't cache properly in the browser so they get loaded over and over and over...

Here's an example:

Response Headers - http://www.randombits.org/download/resources/com.adaptavist.confluence.themes.sitebuilder:sitebuilder/icons/document_plain.png

Date: Wed, 01 Feb 2006 05:52:20 GMT
Server: Resin/3.0.14
Content-Type: image/png
Transfer-Encoding: chunked

200 OK

As you can see, the HTTP header is sparse to say the least.

Here's an example of an image pulled from a normal web server:

Response Headers - http://adaptavist.com/glyphs/about.png

Date: Wed, 01 Feb 2006 06:09:46 GMT
Server: Apache/1.3.29 (Unix) mod_become/1.3 DAV/1.0.3 mod_perl/1.29 PHP/4.3.9 mod_fastcgi/2.4.2
Last-Modified: Thu, 11 Aug 2005 16:28:48 GMT
Etag: "50b29b-30e-42fb7cc0"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Length: 782
Content-Type: image/png

200 OK

As you can see, there are certain things in the header that would certainly help with caching:

    * Last-Modified - allow browser to know if it has the correct version of the file
    * Content-Length - allow browser to know if the file is the same size
    * Etag - allows the browser to check it's got the same entity reference

Then there is the chunked transfer encoding output from the resource URL - I'm just guessing here, but that's going to make it very difficult indeed for the browser to work out if it has the latest file or not? Pretend to be a web browser for a minute, and decide if you'd want to work out if you already had a chunked file cached or not:

http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html#sec3.6.1

I don't know which of these things, if any, would actually alter caching, but it seems that if the HTTP headers from resources could be "fleshed out" a little to give some extra information, there would be a higher chance of the browser caching resources.

So, my question is: Can we output additional HTTP headers AND can we have them sent non-chunked?

Without these two vital things, pulling files from resources is going to be slooooowwww. As a growing number of plugins are using resources in this way (images, css, javascript, etc), we're going to see Confluence sites using lots of plugins getting slower and slower.

If the servlet that sends out the files uses the jar's date as the Last-Modified and also sends the file normally and puts it's Content-Length on, things should run a lot quicker for all resources pulled from plugins, ie. a Confluence-level optimisation. Of course, there may be times when a resource needs a different date (eg. dynamically created resources) so there would have to be a way to define this. From my understanding, however, resources that are simply pulled form the jar (ie. a file in the jar) will never be dynamic?

David Peterson will no doubt be along shortly to add to this (eg. the idea about dumping the files on to disk so they can be pulled more easily without needing to go in to the jar each time)...
fields.summary: Plugin resource servlet does not provide headers necessary for caching

fields.description:
Attachment have an optional comment.

By default embedded images currently have no title attribute (tooltip).

When attached images are embedded, we should use the comment as the tooltip/title text.
fields.summary: Use attachment comment as 'title' text when embedding attached images
link to confluence search syntax documentation

fields.description:
Need to switch on stats collection: 

http://pgsqld.active-venture.com/monitoring-stats.html

Queries: 

select * from pg_stat_user_tables order by seq_scan desc

and

select * from pg_stat_user_indexes order by idx_scan desc
fields.summary: Investigate performance gains of multicolumn and functional indexes in Postgres

fields.description:
This may be the intended functionality but it could also be a bug.

From any page, if you go to Info > View Page History, you'll get  a list of all the different versions of the page including the current version. If you hover over each version, you'll see each has it's own URL with a pageId.  The pageId's for all v.X pages are unique.  But the pageID for the current page isn't unique. It always links to the current page. It seems to be just another form of this type of URL: http://www.isis.jhu.edu/display/ISIS/Status+List.  

We are using page history links to document pages at particular snapshots in time.  For example, I edit a page, save it, then go to Info > View Page History to get the "unique" URL for the page I just saved.  I use that link as documentation to show what my page looked like on 2/6/2006 at 2pm.  However that URL, even though it contains a pageId always links to whatever the current version of the page is.  The historical linking only works with the URLs under v.X pages.  

So to do what I am trying to do, I must go back to the page, edit it, add a slight modification such as a space, then save again. Now my "current" page has been pushed back into v.X and I can get a URL that will actually link to the version I saved on 2/6/2006. 

Is this a bug or is it intended to function this way?
fields.summary: "Current' link URL in page version history always links to current version

fields.description: When a new space is created the standard text inserted in the home page still refers to the old Page Operations menu on the rhs  of the browser window.
fields.summary: Boilerplate text in a new Space still refers to 'You can edit the content of this page using the Edit link on the right.'

fields.description: Right now you can only add group membership when viewing by user. Should be able to add users to a group from the group interface.
fields.summary: Add groups to a user easier
Transfer Actions from one user to another

fields.description:
Text-only notifications of news-entries are broken. Instead of the actual news content the notification mail contains the unresolved velocity variable "$page.content".
The right variable seems to be "$blog.content" so if you correct that name in the appropriate template (confluence/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/text/createblogpost-notification.vm), text-only email notifications will work as expected.
fields.summary: Text-only notification email of new blog post does contain unresolved velocity variable

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to put a valid FROM address in the mail notifications.  Ideally it would be great if you can configure the email notifications to come from the logged into users email address.

For instance, if user A made a change on a page, the notifications that are sent, come from user A's actual email address instead of a default address (which may or may not exist).
fields.summary: eMail Notifications FROM field should be more customizable

fields.description:
Content such as the line below doesn't work properly because properties are split on spaces.

!image.jpg|alt=Hello world!

Really, properties should only be split on commas (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF20/Embedding+Multimedia+Content).

(Initially raised by Guy Fraser on conf-user mailing list.)
fields.summary: Embedded content properties split on spaces as well as commas

fields.description:
A pair of '@' symbols with text between them is rendered as input field (as for Confluence templates). Escaping the @ symbol does not work - the string is rendered with the '\' included.
"@xyz@"  is rendered as input field, "\@xyz\@" is rendered with '\' included.

fields.description:
Yeah, I'm on a roll.
This one is starting to bug me.
Basically you create a new table and select a cell in that table, if you select slight to the right of the center of the cell you will end up with a space infront of the first thing you type. Dunno if its just me but I'm always getting spaces infront :(
fields.summary: When selecting a cell in a table you quite often end up with a space infront of your first character

fields.description:
I have an image on a page called: whatever.PNG

If I search for "whatever" my whatever.PNG won't show up in the list.
Of course the work-around is to add 'whatever' to the attchment comments. 

However I think it's very reasonable to expect the file name to be indexed as well, especially since nowadays we can use filenames with more than 8 letters so often the names are quite descriptive!
fields.summary: Filenames aren't indexed

fields.description: Right now the only way to limit what pages a search can analyze is to put all the pages into one particular space. However, this is a particularly heavyweight method to support this functionality. One possible solution to this would be to optionally have a search consider a subset of pages that are labelled with a list of labels.

For example, ask people to answer to a seminar form (name, participation or not...) and print the results (names of participants...) in another page.

fields.description:
EXPLANATION: PLEASE READ BEFORE COMMENTING.

In order for Confluence layouts to display the information they do, the templates must be given access to a wide range of internal Confluence data and functionality. This means, however, that a the templates themselves are actually _more_ powerful (can see more information and perform more operations) than a space administrator.

It is feasable, given a well-written layout, that a space administrator could grant themselves the power to do anything a global administrator can do.

Because of this, layout editing has been limited to global administrators only. If you want to give someone the power to edit space-level layouts you may as well give them global administrative access, because effectively, that's what you would be doing anyway!

The only real solution to this problem is to redesign, from the ground up, how space look and feel customisation works, providing a limited, safe set of capabilities (and probably a custom templating language). This is something we're considering for future Confluence development, but obviously it's a significant task and not something we can just implement overnight.

fields.description:
I've been attempting to get confluence running with a Firebird (http://firebird.sourceforge.net/) database, which has its dialect included in hibernate-2.1.8-atlassian.jar.

Setting up the external database seems fine, with JayBird jdbc drivers, a network database URL through port 3050 and the dialect.

The setup procedure runs into trouble trying to insert tables into the database, because of the use of reserved words, or key size is too large.

From the server log: (complete log attached)

fields.description:
The searching Syntax indicates the following capabilities:

- To search for content that contains "chalk" but NOT "cheese" 
chalk NOT cheese
I found cases when this does not work and returns results that contains both words.
It may be linked with fact that the first word mixes letters and digits: EN9100 NOT principles
Same problem using the form:
chalk -cheese

- To search for "butter" or "batter" you can use the search: 
b?tter
I cannot get this to work and a search for "sim?lator" doesn't find my pages with "simulator"

- You can also use the wildcard in the middle of a term.
b*tter doesn't work either.

We consider this as a serious problem because it is utmost important for the users to know that they can rely on the search engine. This is one of the key components in a Wiki system.
fields.summary: Search results do not take into account exclusions (NOT) nor wild card characters (?)

fields.description:
I have some problems changing the Global logo of our confluence environment.

Our company has a new name and a new logo and i tried to change it in the Administration Console of Confluence like i did it before with our old logo.
The logo didn't change and the old logo stayed in screen.
I tried changing it to default and that worked (it showed the atlassian logo) but after i did that the logo still didnt change, now i can't even change it back to the Old logo i used.
When i try and upload an image for a logo now i don't get an error but the picture is just not displaying. and the logo is still set to the Atlassian logo and also says that the current logo still is Default.

fields.summary: Problem changing global logo

fields.description:
I expect that confluence-administrator can see all pages including restricted pages - and it can.
However, confluence-administrator cannot see restricted pages listed in tree/alphabetical/recently changed views.....
fields.summary: confluence-administrator can see restricted pages - but cant see these pages listed in tree/alphabetical view
XML RPC Group/User Management Functions

fields.description:
We have problems with any makros embedded in headers and the rich text editor.

In WIKI-Markup it works without problems, but if you edit it in Rich text editor and you will switch back to WIKI-Markup it appears differently and you are not able to save the page correctly. Worst case is that you 'destroy' the appearance of the page or you get an error message (e.g.: h3. {children} )

The way out is to set WIKI - markup as default and edit the page again, then you can change the page and save it correctly.
fields.summary: Embedded macros in headers does'nt work

fields.description:
These are stored as question marks (??????) in the confluence-global.bandana.xml file. 

Users report that the correct characters are displayed immediately after Site Welcome Message is updated, but shortly afterwards they appear as question marks.
fields.summary: Cannot store unicode characters in Site Welcome Message

fields.description: Left hand menu is very sexy, but it should remember what's been opened. For example, if it expand "Page Operations" I would expect it to be opened for the next page. We do this in JIRA by storing this as cookies on the client side
fields.summary: Left hand menu should remember what's open

fields.description: We need to test the more popular 3rd party macros in Wysiwyg mode, understand the issues and explain to authors how to make their macros coexist. Macros should 'fail-safe'.
fields.summary: Test 3rd party macros with rich text editor

fields.description:
We (and probably many users)  want to add stats tracking to Confluence. This usually involves signing up with a tracking service (we have Omniture) and dropping some HTML & javascript on every page in the site. In the case of omniture, we put the code right after the body tag. But other tracking systems would want it in the head, or at the bottom of the body.

In any case, I think we want an admin function that will let us drop some arbitrary HTML into a page at a certain point.
fields.summary: Ability to add stuff to every page on Confluence (e.g., omniture tracking)

fields.description: Currently in the plain website theme, users with edit permission can not see the attachments tab or any news that is posted in the news tab (via browse space). It would be nice that these users would be presented with the standard Confluence interface whilst anonymous users will be presented with the plain website look.
fields.summary: In the plain website theme, users with edit permission should see the standard Confluence interface.

fields.description: We would like to see pages that are being edited locked.  This will keep multiple people from editing the same page at the same time.  Since you already know it is being edited, it seems it would be a minor change to stop the editing from taking place.
fields.summary: Page Lock While Editing

fields.description:
The labels macro (showing the labels for a given space) links to the global labels pages always.

If you specify a space (ie {labels:spacekey=CONF}) the links point to the global labelled pages, which is confusing for users (as they jump out of the space theme, and they get results which aren't from the space they just clicked on).

Rule: if a space key is specified, links should be to space only list of pages with that label. If no space, global page.
fields.summary: Labels macro links aren't space relative

fields.description:
When editing a page, and swap between "Rich Text" and "WikiMarckup" views, the wikimarkup notation in attachments is replaced by links notations.

Example:

WikiMarkup view: [^x.doc]
swap to RichText view
swap back to WikiMarkup view: [x.doc]
fields.summary: Swap between editing page views result in wikimarkup replacement
Plugin Execution for Plugin Manager Events

fields.description: When a page is deleted, and an user set to watch it, the page still appear in the watches list, and result in error page when click over the link.
fields.summary: Un-updated watches list when deleting watch  page

fields.description:
I monitor pages for changes, and am having problems with the generated URL.  When someone updates a page, I get the email, with a link to changes like:

Changes: http://xxx.xxx.xxx/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=313&originalVersion=90&revisedVersion=91

The problem is the change that was made was from 89 to 90, not 90 to 91.  Clicking this link will give me an error that it couldn't find the specified page version.  I've tried reindexing, to no avail.
fields.summary: Change URL has wrong version number in update email
Make quick search scope a site configurable option
Include breadcrumbs in HTML export

fields.description:
When you export a confluence space in HTML format the attachments, althought they are packaged in the exported zip file, are not accessible since the HTML tag (in the exported HTML souce code) <a href=... points to an external URL and not to the new, relative file path on the locally exported repository.

This also applies to images in the ../icons/emoticons directory. Once the space is exported to HTML the href for all these icons point to a wrong relative file path.

This applies to all pages, no matter whether you are using unicode/high-bit characters in the page title or not.
fields.summary: HTML Export fails to redirect URL attachments to the "locally" exported directory structure

fields.description:
This code:

!CRM-H2_link_a_visit's_task_to_a_SR.swf|height=480,width=640!  hangs forever because of the apostrophe in the attachment
!CRM-H2_link_a_visits_task_to_a_SR.swf|height=480,width=640!  works as expected once the apostrophe has been removed (in the attached file too of course)
fields.summary: Apostrophe in attachment filename causes problems with the embedded resource renderer

fields.description:
This only affects Internet Explorer - we haven't seen this with Firefox.

If you edit a page using the WYSIWYG editor, if the editor pane has a scroll bar and you scroll to the bottom of the page then move the mouse over the "wiki markup" or "preview" tabs it scroll the editor pane to the top.
fields.summary: Hovering over the tabs in the editor view causes page to scroll on IE

fields.description:
Export to word doesn't always work when a page contains Japanese characters.

It does work exporting to MS Word on OS X, but not on Windows.

Japanese characters are not correctly encoded.

In addition to that, the output appears to be truncated, perhaps by the same number of characters as there are multi-byte characters in the output.
fields.summary: Export to Word doesn't work with Japanese

fields.description:
It seems there is no history or rollback to previous versions possible with the blog/news post !?
Also any authenticated user can change a blog post, which can not be restricted on a news-level ?

If the above is correct, this should get corrected... don't you think ?
fields.summary: News/Blog history and permission setup

Solutions:
- restart Confluence, everything works fine til next Configuration edit
- wait a while... (20 minutes or so?) some timeout times out and it works on

In previous versions the behaviour of the insert link button was sub-optimal too with safari (link got inserted at the end of the whole edit area content, not inplace) but now it seems to be really destructive.

fields.description:
Seems to be a Firefox issue, since I can't reproduce the bug in IE 6. I was feeling in an extra generous mood and ran firefox in safemode to make sure none of my extensions were the cause.

Steps to reproduce:

Create a new page.

Select the wiki editor

Put in characters until you a scroll bar appears (eg. sad <enter> loads of times)

Error rendering macro: java.lang.NullPointerException

In View: no problem

fields.summary: breadcrumb for when you view the "drafts" tab from your profile is wrong.

fields.description:
All javascript pop-up links should have correct HREF attributes. Links that opens a new window should have HREF that *points* to that page, to be more accessible. You can then middle click on a link, open in a new windoe etc. and it executes correctly, on all browsers.

I do this with the Wiki Help lots and it seems to work in one version and becomes broken in the next. Quite a PITA.

This issue can be closed when we fix it for Wiki Help, but I think generally wehn using window.open, people should be aware of this (don't just link to #)
fields.summary: All javascript pop-up links should have correct HREF attributes.

fields.description:
Why is the WYSIWYG editor breaking the source in this release? Tell it to leave it alone.

links that look like this: [#anch1] when getting saved via the WYSIWYG view is turning into this [anch1]

Steps to reproduce:
Create a new page

Paste in this in the wiki markup view:
[#anch1]
[#anch2]

{anchor:anch1}
{anchor:anch2}

save.

edit the page.

switch to the Rich Text editor

save

now the links are broken.
fields.summary: loosing anchor links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-5317].
  {panel}

There is a bug with this macro when used in IE 6 (with most recent patches).
Repro:
1. Use {dynamictasklist} in a page.
2. Add a task
3. Click on del to delete the task
Current Behavior:
The circular arrow shows up and it keeps rolling and then gets stuck. The only way to get past it is to refresh the page.

Expected Behavior:
Just like in firefox, the arrow should show up, the task should get deleted and everything should be good.
fields.summary: dynamictasklist macro delete fails on IE

fields.description:
A customer has requested that we consider moving the Confluence WYSIWYG editor to be based on HTML instead of wiki markup.

The reasoning behind this is that Confluence's WYSIWYG editor is built upon a HTML based WYSIWYG edtior. A lot of the functionality and potential currently within the WYSIWYG editor component is disable to become WIKI markup compliant. If we were to move to a WYSIWYG editor based on HTML the WYSIWYG editor would therefore be far more capable. 

As part of this wiki markup mode would be complemented or replaced by a HTML editor mode. It would also be nice if you could, at an administration level, flip between WIKI markup and HTML. 

It would be good if you also could switch between these modes (wiki/HTML) on a space or page level and better yet if you could do this as an editing option that appears in EDIT mode.
fields.summary: Move to WYSIWYG editor based on HTML instead of wiki markup. Replace wiki markup mode with HTML editor mode.

fields.description:
It would be really useful if Confluence had a virtual space.

A virtual space is much like a normal space, it has configuration (permissions, theme, layout) *BUT* does not have its own content, it uses the content of another space.

The use-case is that a project wants to use a website-like layout (no user specific data, common navigation, etc) for its main website, but still wants the current wiki-layout to edit/manage the content.

A related example, is the ActiveMQ project hosted at the Codehaus.  Its main website is using Confluenza (a simple script to scrape data from Confluence and render it as a website):

    http://activemq.codehaus.org/

This site's content maps directly to the pages under:

    http://docs.codehaus.org/display/ACTIVEMQ/Home

Confluence could be configured directly to render the first, but by doing so it looses some of the nice wiki-like features for editing the content on the second URL.

So, why not allow both to be used inside of Confluence?  So, that is basic idea of a virtual space, it has its own perms/layout configuration, but uses another spaced content.

This is somewhat related to:

    http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Running+Confluence+Behind+a+Caching+Proxy+Server

Some of the projects that use Confluenza at the Codehaus are moving to Apache, and currently Apache's Infra group does not want to run Confluence (or Confluenza) due to scaling problems.  So, some people (myself and James included) have been looking into alternative ways to fix this problem.  Some of which involve reinventing the style/layout/theme support that Confluence already has, then rendering the site to HTML periodically to make ASF Infra happy.

But, it would be ideal if we did not have to rewrite the layout/theme, but could just reuse Confluence for this... and still keep the regular confluence layout for editing.

Virtualized spaces would really add some added flexibility and power to Confluence, quite possibly making it the most powerful wiki in the know universe... or isn't that already the case ;-)
fields.summary: Virtual Spaces (Custom layouts/configuration for shared space content)

fields.description: If an LDAP group contains a member which doesn't exist, Confluence gets the name from the group, gets a user (which returns null) and then does things with the null pointer, rather than reporting that the group contains a user which doesn't exist (it does log it, but not in a clear way)
fields.summary: Non-existent users in groups cause problems when using LDAP
